package nmam;

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Collections;
import java.util.Comparator;

class Product  implements Comparable<Product> {
	int price;
	int qty;
	String name;
	public Product() {
		// TODO Auto-generated constructor stub
	}
	public Product(int price, int qty, String name) {
		super();
		this.price = price;
		this.qty = qty;
		this.name = name;
	}
	
	public String toString() {
		return price+" "+qty+" "+name;
	}
	 
	@Override
	public int compareTo(Product o) {
		 System.out.println("hi......");
		 String n1=this.name;
		 String n2=o.name;
		return n1.compareTo(n2);
	}

	
	
}
 

public class Test1   { 
	
	 public static void main(String []args) {
Product p1 = new Product(1000, 20, "mobile");
Product p2 = new Product(674, 2, "watch")â€¦
package nmam;

 
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map.Entry;
import java.util.Set;

public class Test1   { 
	
	 public static void main(String []args) {
		HashMap<Integer,String> m = new HashMap<>();
		m.put(1,"janu");
		m.put(2,"priya");
		m.put(1,"rena");
		m.put(3, null);
		m.put(5, null);
		m.put(4, "dhanya");
		 System.out.println(m);
	Set<Entry<Integer,String>> ent=	m.entrySet();
	
	for(Entry<Integer, String> m1  :ent)
	{
		System.out.println(m1.getKey()+"="+m1.getValue());
	}
	 
		
	 }
	 }
package nmam;

 
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map.Entry;
import java.util.Set;

public class Test1   { 
	
	 public static void main(String []args) {
		HashMap<Integer,String> m = new HashMap<>();
		m.put(1,"janu");
		m.put(2,"priya");
		m.put(1,"rena");
		m.put(3, null);
		m.put(5, null);
		m.put(4, "dhanya");
		 System.out.println(m);
	Set<Entry<Integer,String>> ent=	m.entrySet();

	for(Entry<Integer, String> m1  :ent)
	{
		if(m1.getKey()==4) {
			 m.replace(m1.getKey(), "sample");
			//m.put(m1.getKey(), "sample");
		}
		 
	}
	 
	System.out.println(m);
		
	 }
	 }
package nmam;

 
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Iterator;
import java.util.Map.Entry;
import java.util.Set;

public class Test1   { 
	
	 public static void main(String []args) {
		HashMap<Integer,String> m = new HashMap<>();
		m.put(1,"janu");
		m.put(2,"priya");
		m.put(1,"rena");
		m.put(3, null);
		m.put(5, null);
		m.put(4, "dhanya");
		 System.out.println(m);
	 
		    Set<Entry<Integer,String>> set=m.entrySet();  
		    Iterator<Entry<Integer,String>> itr=set.iterator();  
		    while(itr.hasNext()){    
		    	//System.out.println(itr.next());
		    	 Entry<Integer,String> entry= itr.next();  
		         System.out.println(entry.getKey()+":"+entry.getValue());  
		    }  

		
	 }
	 }
